description: CyberPatriot is an amazing free program. It is a  National Youth Cyber Education Program with emphasis on the national competition. In this course you will be introduced to the program, competition and basic skills needed to compete. This course should be used as a supplement to tools provided by your Coach, Technical Mentor, and resources covered in these videos. There are a great deal resources available to prepare you. Please take advantage of them.
descriptionMD: CyberPatriot is an amazing free program. It is a  National Youth Cyber Education Program with emphasis on the national competition. In this course you will be introduced to the program, competition and basic skills needed to compete. This course should be used as a supplement to tools provided by your Coach, Technical Mentor, and resources covered in these videos. There are a great deal resources available to prepare you. Please take advantage of them.For registration and more information please visit [their website.](https://www.uscyberpatriot.org/)
name: CyberPatriot
subtitle: National Youth Cyber Education Program

episodes.description: This segment highlights information pertaining to the CyberPatriot program. You will also be introduced to our show host Cherokee Boose and special guest Professor Steve Linthicum.
episodes.title: Program Overview
episodes.transcript:
WEBVTT

1
00:00:00.025 --> 00:00:04.734
[SOUND] Welcome ladies and gentlemen.

2
00:00:04.734 --> 00:00:06.857
You've heard this term, Cyber Patriot, but

3
00:00:06.857 --> 00:00:10.570
you might not understand all the details
associated with this program.

4
00:00:10.570 --> 00:00:13.250
That's okay, because I'm going
to go ahead and help you out.

5
00:00:13.250 --> 00:00:14.610
My name is Cherokee Boose and

6
00:00:14.610 --> 00:00:18.090
I'll be acting as a show host
through the duration of these shows.

7
00:00:18.090 --> 00:00:22.930
We also have a very special guest named
Professor Steve Linthecome travelling

8
00:00:22.930 --> 00:00:26.480
all the way from California to go ahead
and help you with these training videos.

9
00:00:26.480 --> 00:00:28.370
So let's go ahead and
give him a warm welcome here.

10
00:00:28.370 --> 00:00:29.270
Welcome Steve.

11
00:00:29.270 --> 00:00:30.550
>> Thank you very much.

12
00:00:30.550 --> 00:00:33.460
And for you students out there,
one of the reasons why

13
00:00:33.460 --> 00:00:37.380
I decided that this would be a great
idea to work on putting this together,

14
00:00:37.380 --> 00:00:41.240
is I looked at the materials that you
had available to you from Cyber Patriot.

15
00:00:41.240 --> 00:00:44.900
There were a whole series of slides,
and we're going to use those slides so

16
00:00:44.900 --> 00:00:48.380
that we can present the materials in
a fashion that I think will be much

17
00:00:48.380 --> 00:00:50.310
easier for you to absorb.

18
00:00:50.310 --> 00:00:56.450
And I really want to thank ITProTV for
allowing me to come here and to provide

19
00:00:56.450 --> 00:01:00.750
you with these materials because I think
it'll really benefit you as students.

20
00:01:00.750 --> 00:01:03.880
So why don't we go over to
the slides that I prepared?

21
00:01:03.880 --> 00:01:06.280
Now, that's just basically
the introductory slide.

22
00:01:06.280 --> 00:01:12.300
But as we go through it, I want to comment
relative to what I call resource partners.

23
00:01:12.300 --> 00:01:16.513
And they're a bunch of entities that
helped put this project together.

24
00:01:16.513 --> 00:01:20.986
Obviously one of them is ITPROTV, but
we also have the CYBERPATRIOT program,

25
00:01:20.986 --> 00:01:22.817
we're using their materials,

26
00:01:22.817 --> 00:01:26.636
you're benefiting from what this
group of individuals has done.

27
00:01:26.636 --> 00:01:29.697
They're sponsored by
the airforce association,

28
00:01:29.697 --> 00:01:34.108
North of is a key sponsor associated
with them, we have NDG here,

29
00:01:34.108 --> 00:01:38.875
NDG has a course that you're going to be
able to have free access to The will teach

30
00:01:38.875 --> 00:01:42.030
you Linux principles and
I think it's really good.

31
00:01:42.030 --> 00:01:46.950
There is incidentally with ITProTV,
you're also going to have access to

32
00:01:46.950 --> 00:01:51.870
a free IT fundamentals course, which we go
through a little bit of networking here,

33
00:01:51.870 --> 00:01:53.220
but we can't cover it all.

34
00:01:53.220 --> 00:01:54.920
So you're gonna have access to that.

35
00:01:54.920 --> 00:01:58.080
We got the Cisco Network Academy
that's providing you

36
00:01:58.080 --> 00:02:00.930
access to their net academy program And
there are a whole

37
00:02:00.930 --> 00:02:03.565
bunch of modules that your coach
is going to have you go through.

38
00:02:03.565 --> 00:02:05.890
There.s Cyber Watch West,

39
00:02:05.890 --> 00:02:11.040
that's a academic centre of
excellence based out of Washington.

40
00:02:11.040 --> 00:02:13.025
They are a key participant.

41
00:02:13.025 --> 00:02:17.440
We;ve got My College Sierra College
it's obviously a key participant and

42
00:02:17.440 --> 00:02:21.210
the North by North Regional Consortium
my college is a member of that.

43
00:02:21.210 --> 00:02:22.670
They've supported this effort.

44
00:02:22.670 --> 00:02:26.150
And I really want to thank the California
Community College Chancellor's Office that

45
00:02:26.150 --> 00:02:27.620
has provided funding for

46
00:02:27.620 --> 00:02:31.190
this particular effort under
their doing what matters program.

47
00:02:31.190 --> 00:02:34.685
So these are all key resource-
>> Looks like a lot of people really

48
00:02:34.685 --> 00:02:38.725
care and are putting forth efforts to go
ahead and make this initiative happen.

49
00:02:38.725 --> 00:02:41.295
And Steven I do appreciate
you thanking ITProTV.

50
00:02:41.295 --> 00:02:45.486
But we'd like to thank you as well, and
thank all of the adults and participants,

51
00:02:45.486 --> 00:02:47.870
the new students, as well, for doing this.

52
00:02:47.870 --> 00:02:52.540
Because it's such a great opportunity to
really set you up for a better lifestyle.

53
00:02:52.540 --> 00:02:55.230
>> And the reason it's going to set
you up for a better lifestyle is,

54
00:02:55.230 --> 00:02:58.120
if you prefer to go down this career path.

55
00:02:58.120 --> 00:03:00.280
As you go through here and
you learn cybersecurity.

56
00:03:00.280 --> 00:03:02.810
If you think, boy,
this would be fun to do as a job.

57
00:03:02.810 --> 00:03:06.780
I want to show you this next slide,
because I think it's really important.

58
00:03:06.780 --> 00:03:10.860
This is a recent slide shot,
a screen shot.

59
00:03:10.860 --> 00:03:12.380
Of the CyberSeek site.

60
00:03:12.380 --> 00:03:15.470
You can go to it, it's at cyberseek.org.

61
00:03:15.470 --> 00:03:18.460
It was funded by NIST,

62
00:03:18.460 --> 00:03:23.000
which is the National Institute of,
what is it, Standards and Technology.

63
00:03:23.000 --> 00:03:23.500
>> Technology.

64
00:03:23.500 --> 00:03:26.180
>> Yeah, sometimes I want to say-
>> We have so many acronyms.

65
00:03:26.180 --> 00:03:27.645
>> Yeah, they do.
>> And you guys will find that out.

66
00:03:27.645 --> 00:03:28.620
[LAUGH]
>> They do, and

67
00:03:28.620 --> 00:03:31.000
if you look at this slide
>> And

68
00:03:31.000 --> 00:03:35.420
I pulled this last night
off of the Internet.

69
00:03:35.420 --> 00:03:40.030
It indicates here in the lower
left hand corner that there

70
00:03:40.030 --> 00:03:45.150
are currently in
the United States 348,975 jobs.

71
00:03:45.150 --> 00:03:45.840
>> Overwhelming.

72
00:03:45.840 --> 00:03:49.450
>> The workforce,
the totally employed workforce right now

73
00:03:49.450 --> 00:03:53.500
is about three quarters of a million
>> People, now slightly over that.

74
00:03:53.500 --> 00:03:54.270
But look at that.

75
00:03:54.270 --> 00:03:55.867
all them are
>> You see that huge deficit there.

76
00:03:55.867 --> 00:03:58.040
>> Yeah.
They're working all those 3 quarters of

77
00:03:58.040 --> 00:04:01.300
a million are working and yet
we have vacancies in 300,

78
00:04:01.300 --> 00:04:06.000
in almost 350,000 positions,
so there is a heck of

79
00:04:06.000 --> 00:04:11.110
an opportunity here across the nation
relative to jobs out there.

80
00:04:11.110 --> 00:04:15.340
And what we need,
is we need people in those jobs.

81
00:04:15.340 --> 00:04:17.680
And you're well equipped to get there.

82
00:04:17.680 --> 00:04:19.880
You go through the Cyber Patriot program,

83
00:04:19.880 --> 00:04:22.120
perhaps go to a community
college like Sierra,

84
00:04:22.120 --> 00:04:27.220
go through our training programs that are
tied to industry driven certifications.

85
00:04:27.220 --> 00:04:30.780
And that's funny with cybersecurity and
with a lot of IT,

86
00:04:30.780 --> 00:04:35.250
those industry driven certifications
are of utmost importance.

87
00:04:35.250 --> 00:04:37.740
They prove to employers
that you know something.

88
00:04:37.740 --> 00:04:39.630
They prove to employers
because to keep them,

89
00:04:39.630 --> 00:04:42.740
you've got to continue
continuing education we call it.

90
00:04:42.740 --> 00:04:43.360
>> Lifelong learners.

91
00:04:43.360 --> 00:04:44.920
>> Yeah lifelong learners.

92
00:04:44.920 --> 00:04:50.690
And so it's really important that you go
through and you achieve those objectives.

93
00:04:50.690 --> 00:04:54.110
And what a great job this is.

94
00:04:54.110 --> 00:04:57.280
The key elements of it with regard
to cybersecurity here, it's a bit of

95
00:04:57.280 --> 00:05:02.160
a challenge for companies and for
governments to outsource cybersecurity.

96
00:05:02.160 --> 00:05:05.990
Beyond the jurisdictional limits of
the courts of the United States.

97
00:05:05.990 --> 00:05:11.120
The FBI can't chase you in Eastern Europe
very well if you do something wrong,

98
00:05:11.120 --> 00:05:15.270
so the employers are going to want to
make sure you're from this country and

99
00:05:15.270 --> 00:05:17.820
you're in this country
as you do your work.

100
00:05:17.820 --> 00:05:22.670
Another great news about this job is
because so much of what you do is remote,

101
00:05:22.670 --> 00:05:26.790
meaning you're going to remote into
systems, you don't necessarily

102
00:05:26.790 --> 00:05:31.170
need to be in an office building, your
company's office building to do your work.

103
00:05:31.170 --> 00:05:34.565
You might be working from home,
you might be working from the beach.

104
00:05:34.565 --> 00:05:38.420
>> [LAUGH] There really are so many
benefits in working in IT, and personally

105
00:05:38.420 --> 00:05:39.270
>> Personally,

106
00:05:39.270 --> 00:05:42.530
I got into IT to really just
better my family's life, and

107
00:05:42.530 --> 00:05:45.150
that's why I say it's possible for
you to do the same.

108
00:05:45.150 --> 00:05:48.130
Because I didn't have a cyber
patriot program like this.

109
00:05:48.130 --> 00:05:51.070
I really wish I did, because I am just so

110
00:05:51.070 --> 00:05:54.770
impressed with the amount of resources
that you guys have available to you.

111
00:05:54.770 --> 00:05:55.840
And here's the thing.

112
00:05:55.840 --> 00:05:58.800
Even if you already don't have
a really solid knowledge base,

113
00:05:58.800 --> 00:06:02.610
that's okay, because you have
a lot of tools at your disposal.

114
00:06:02.610 --> 00:06:06.120
Right and a couple things I wanted
to cover briefly back on the slides.

115
00:06:06.120 --> 00:06:09.450
The way that we've broken this out
generally is at the beginning of

116
00:06:09.450 --> 00:06:14.280
each unit and I believe there are ten
units, you'll have the opening slide.

117
00:06:14.280 --> 00:06:18.500
For example here it will identify
Unit One with its heading.

118
00:06:18.500 --> 00:06:19.980
We will go through it and
we'll go through it and

119
00:06:19.980 --> 00:06:21.690
do the standard sort of
learning objectives.

120
00:06:21.690 --> 00:06:24.390
This is the way we teach today,
we identify the students

121
00:06:24.390 --> 00:06:28.470
learning objectives and then we'll go
through and, so first here im telling you

122
00:06:28.470 --> 00:06:31.650
what im going to teach you, then we'll go
through the modules and I'll teach it.

123
00:06:31.650 --> 00:06:36.570
And then ultimately I'll remind you as to
what I've taught you, so that's kind of

124
00:06:36.570 --> 00:06:38.600
the pattern were going to use

125
00:06:38.600 --> 00:06:39.340
>> 3 t's yea
>> Yea

126
00:06:39.340 --> 00:06:41.120
>> And so here is, for example,

127
00:06:41.120 --> 00:06:42.500
section one.

128
00:06:42.500 --> 00:06:47.160
And at the end of each section, I mean,
at the end of each unit we're going to

129
00:06:47.160 --> 00:06:50.330
go through and this is the final slide and
the purpose of this final slide is

130
00:06:50.330 --> 00:06:53.275
I want this content to remain
>> Current.

131
00:06:53.275 --> 00:06:55.815
And so I have set up a site and
I'll go to it here.

132
00:06:55.815 --> 00:07:00.535
This is the link for it so make sure
you know that link and go and visit it.

133
00:07:00.535 --> 00:07:03.745
This is the main page,this is
the Cyber Patriot learning content.

134
00:07:03.745 --> 00:07:07.975
I've characterize it as center,
and I broken down each module so

135
00:07:07.975 --> 00:07:10.695
that you can see what's there and

136
00:07:10.695 --> 00:07:15.000
I've put in contents that's recent
>> That keeps you up to date

137
00:07:15.000 --> 00:07:16.580
relative to each one of the modules.

138
00:07:16.580 --> 00:07:19.180
So please go as you go
through these units,

139
00:07:19.180 --> 00:07:22.630
make sure to check out that main page and
check out your unit and

140
00:07:22.630 --> 00:07:27.310
see if there are any additional content
that I think is important for you to know.

141
00:07:27.310 --> 00:07:28.100
Cool.

142
00:07:28.100 --> 00:07:31.550
So I'm excited, I don't know if you
guys are, but let's go ahead and

143
00:07:31.550 --> 00:07:34.520
jump into some of that content,
like Steve was just showing us.

144
00:07:34.520 --> 00:07:36.950
We're gonna go ahead and
wrap up this introduction and

145
00:07:36.950 --> 00:07:38.440
get ready, get comfortable.

146
00:07:38.440 --> 00:07:41.120
We've got a lot of really great
information coming your way.

147
00:07:41.120 --> 00:07:44.380
But for this particular segment, I'm
gonna go ahead and sign off as your host,

148
00:07:44.380 --> 00:07:47.220
Cherokee Boose
>> And I'm Professor Steve Linthicum.

149
00:07:47.220 --> 00:07:53.809
>> See you next time here for
CyberPatriot.

150
00:07:53.809 --> 00:07:56.233
[MUSIC]

151
00:07:56.233 --> 00:07:58.160
>> Thank you for watching ITProTV.

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum defines the CyberPatriot program and explains how it relates to Cybersecurity. You will gain a broad understanding why it Cybersecurity is so important.
episodes.title: CyberPatriot and Cybersecurity

episodes.description: In this episode you will learn details about the CyberPartiot competition.
episodes.title: The Competition

episodes.description: In this episode you will see the significance of a career in Cybersecurity.
episodes.title: Introduction to Cybersecurity

episodes.description: Online Safety/Cyberbullying: This segment is an intro into unit 2 as well as information on how to handle cyberbullying.
episodes.title: Online Safety

episodes.description: Personally Identifiable Information: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee discuss PII (Personally Identifiable Information) and some proper techniques to handle it.
episodes.title: Online Safety Part 2

episodes.description: This episode is an introduction to ethics. You will see what ethics are, why they are important, how to act ethically, understanding the associated responsibilities and how ethics are applied in the real world.
episodes.title: Cyber Ethics

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a current event.
episodes.title: Current Event 1

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a current event.
episodes.title: Current Event 2

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a current event.
episodes.title: Current Event 3

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a scenario.
episodes.title: Scenario 1

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a scenario.
episodes.title: Scenario 2

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a scenario.
episodes.title: Scenario 3

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a scenario.
episodes.title: Scenario 4

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a scenario.
episodes.title: Scenario 5

episodes.description: In this segment you will be asked to identify and analyze a scenario. A unit 3 summarization will also be provided.
episodes.title: Scenario 6

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee Boose discuss the basic principles in cybersecurity.
episodes.title: Principles of Cybersecurity

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee Boose explain the CIA Triad. We see confidentiality and how it relates to a moral aspect, integrity and how it relates to verifying the originality, and keeping resources available to our users.
episodes.title: CIA Triad

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee explain some common terminology such as threats, vulnerabilities, exploits and risk. You will also see how to use a risk matrix to help determine critical risks.
episodes.title: Threats and Vulnerabilities

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee outline several cyber threats and techniques to mitigate these threats.
episodes.title: Cyber Threats and Countermeasures

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation where you will further dissect malware terminology. You will learn the differences and similarities between different threats as well as learn how those attacks are executed.
episodes.title: Cyber Threats and Countermeasures Part 2

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee examine the differences between identification, authentication, authorization and accountability.
episodes.title: Basic Cybersecurity Techniques

episodes.description: In this episode you will learn the difference between a secure and unsecure password.
episodes.title: Basic Cybersecurity Techniques Part 2

episodes.description: This segment outlines the objectives for unit 5.
episodes.title: Computer Basics and Virtualization

episodes.description: In this episode we see basic physical components. As well as BIOS.
episodes.title: How Computers Work

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee Boose talk about software. You will see a couple different operating systems and also learn what an application is.
episodes.title: How Computers Work Part 2

episodes.description: In the episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee introduce you to virtual machines. You will also learn virtualization associated terms and technologies.
episodes.title: Virtual Machines

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee acquaint you with the basics of networking. They also identify Cisco’s Learning Network as a study source CyberPatriot participants have available to them.
episodes.title: Networking Basics

episodes.description: This segment is a brief introduction for unit 6.
episodes.title: Microsoft Windows Basics and MSDN

episodes.description: In this this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee take you back in time to help us chronologically identify operating system versions.
episodes.title: Windows Version History

episodes.description: In this this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee explore a Windows operating system environment and explain components such as: The start menu, The directory structure, and file extensions.
episodes.title: Windows Basics

episodes.description: In this this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee have look at Microsoft’s digital store and explain the benefits of Microsoft being  a diamond sponsor of the CyberPatriot program.
episodes.title: What is MSDN

episodes.description: In this episode you will see Professor Steve Linthicum demonstrate how to use an ISO to create a virtual machine for your lab environment.
episodes.title: How to Use MSDN for Training

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee look at the Control Panel, policy settings, Action Center and Windows Defender.
episodes.title: Microsoft Windows Security Tools

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation of exploring basic Security Policies and tools we can use to harden our systems. We see how to access different policies such as the local Security Policy, Password policies and lockout policies. You also will see how to enable Windows Defender, Configure Windows Firewall and Windows Updates.
episodes.title: Basic Security Policies and Tools Part 2

episodes.description: This is a continuation, a part three. We take a deeper look at Windows Firewall.
episodes.title: Basic Security Policies and Tools Part 3

episodes.description: In this this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee show you where to access and manage user account information.
episodes.title: Account Management

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum demonstrates how to create and manage users users and groups to help secure and simplify your environment.
episodes.title: Account Management Part 2

episodes.description: In this segment you will be introduced to unit 8, Microsoft Windows Security Configuration. Professor Steve Linthicum also shows photos of real-life contestants participating in a practice round held at Sierra College.
episodes.title: Microsoft Windows Security Configuration

episodes.description: In this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee explain file permissions. You will also learn about permission inheritance and customizable permissions. In addition to permissions you will see how to encrypt and compress files and folders.
episodes.title: Windows File Protections

episodes.description: In this episode you will lean the importance of Windows Auditing. We see demos of windows logs and policy settings.
episodes.title: Windows Auditing

episodes.description: In this episode you will see how to use real-time monitoring tools such as Performance Monitor and Event Viewer.
episodes.title: Performance Monitoring

episodes.description: This segment covers the learning objectives for unit 9.
episodes.title: Introduction to LInux and Ubuntu

episodes.description: In this this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee introduce you to the wonderful world of Linux.
episodes.title: What is Linux

episodes.description: In this episode you will begin to see some basic Linux terminology and how it relates to windows terms.
episodes.title: Ubuntu Terminology and Concepts

episodes.description: In this this episode Professor Steve Linthicum and Cherokee have look at some terminal commands.
episodes.title: Introduction to Ubuntu Command Lines

episodes.description: This episode is a continuation of terminal command demonstrations.
episodes.title: Introduction to Ubuntu Command Line Part 2

episodes.description: This segment covers the learning objectives for unit 9.
episodes.title: Ubuntu Security

episodes.description: In this episode we learn how to create user accounts, install updates and enable/configure a firewall.
episodes.title: Basic GUI Security

episodes.description: In this episode you will learn the significance of terminal commands such as gedit and PAM files.
episodes.title: Basic Command Line Security

episodes.description: In this episode you will learn the significance of terminal commands such as ls and chmod. You will also note the system log structure, look at group creation and services.
episodes.title: Advanced Ubuntu Security
